content.description:
A short route up the south side of the formation that’s ‘easier than it looks.’ Very little pro down low, the first solid protection is slinging a large block about 20’ off the deck. Better gear in the crack higher up.

 A short write up on the climb: TheMtsAreCalling.com/pickle…;
content.protection: Medium nuts and cams, long runners to sling several knobs and blocks on lead. Webbing to touch up the anchor (two bolts- one new, one old).
content.location: Approach the Pickle as describe on the area page. Work around to the base on the south side.

content.description: A ‘short and squat’ spire just east of the Prong. There’s a nice 5.4 route on the south side to the summit, that makes for an easy add on if you’re in the area to climb The Hand or The Tower.
